Posts.Content: Mar 16, 2010 10:35AM VRamos wrote: Thank you for your responses - i am seeing the breast surgeon tomorrow.  I have some anxiety as I don't know what will happen - I am just trying to focus on my kids and thinking positive.  As I have been telling more people in my inner circle - it is amazing how many women are going or have been through this.  There are so many success stories that it gives me hope.  I will keep you posted.  Good Health and Best of luck.
Posts.Title: Newly Diagnosed & Overwhelmed VRamos bogdany22

Posts.Content: VRamos wrote: I am 44 years old and a mother of three and I found out a week ago that I have breast cancer.  What a SHOCK!!!! So overwhelmed with the unknown.  I have an appointment with a surgeon on 3/17/10 - i am so afraid.  Pathology reports states invasive - DCIS - little over 2cm - early stage.  I took an MRI - Nodes appear clear - I am so stunned I feel I was given a death sentence.  I really need support. Log in to post a reply
